ca.uhn.hl7v2.hoh.hapi.client

Class HohClientMultithreaded

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uhn.hl7v2.hoh.hapi.client.AbstractClient<HohRawClientMultithreaded>
      • ca.uhn.hl7v2.hoh.hapi.client.HohClientMultithreaded
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IClient, IClientMultithreaded
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RelayHttpSender

    public class HohClientMultithreaded
extends AbstractClient<HohRawClientMultithreaded>
implements IClientMultithreaded

    Message sender using the HL7 over HTTP specification which uses a ScheduledExecutorService to provide advanced functionality such as persistent connections which time out and close automatically.

    This connector uses an executor service which can start worker threads, so use caution if embedding within a J2EE container.

        Parameters:
        theHost - The HOST (name/address). E.g. "192.168.1.1"
        thePort - The PORT. E.g. "8080"
        theUriPath - The URI being requested (must either be blank or start with '/' and contain a path). E.g. "/Apps/Receiver.jsp"
        theParser - The Parser to use, or null in which case a PipeParser will be used

    • Method Detail

      • getSocketTimeout

        public long getSocketTimeout()

        Returns the number of millis to keep an idle socket open before closing it.

        Specified by:
        getSocketTimeout in interface IClientMultithreaded

      • setSocketTimeout

        public void setSocketTimeout(long theSocketTimeout)

        Sets the number of millis to keep an idle socket open before closing it. This value may be changed at any time. Default is HohRawClientMultithreaded.DEFAULT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT

        A value of -1 indicates that connections do not time out (use with caution).

        Note that this parameter is respected on a best-effort basis, timeouts may be different, especially under heavy load

        Specified by:
        setSocketTimeout in interface IClientMultithreaded
